intro: Scleranthus expansus, commonly known as the broadleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in open, disturbed habitats. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Scleranthus expansus is often found in grasslands, along roadsides, and in other arid environments.
